subject: init wayland support
commitMessage:
init wayland support

The display server based on X or Wayland, is now a choice of different profile in Tizen 3.0.
Basically and consistently, two macros were used "with wayland" and "with x".
Below summarize the combination of the macros:

    | wayland |  x  | meaning
    |---------------------------
    |   0     |  1  | pure X11 platform(no wayland)
    |   1     |  0  | pure wayland platform (no X11)
    |   1     |  1  | wayland but X compatibility
    |   0     |  0  | no X and no wayland

This method unifies the meaning and usage. Deploy this method to starter package.

Signed-off-by: Li,Limin <liminx.li@intel.com>
Change-Id: Idcdda548d545720c7649c10afba209be48fa33c9

subject: Fix lang and invalid group rpmlint errors
commitMessage: Fix lang and invalid group rpmlint errors

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

The tag submit/tizen/20130801.215030 is pushed, but this submission failed because of following reason(s):

- The commit e7b8d9df6969528c5d3f069a4ce0b2eb31cdbb9c is still under review in gerrit. After reviewer accpet this commit, it will be submitted to OBS corresponding project.

Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+1

sdbd is failing to build because starter is failing to build. This is failing on rpmlint errors. Mainly %find_lang. I fixed the lang part, but I am not sure how to deal with the resulting duplicate file error. Doesn't seem right to delete the dupe (en_PH is a duple of en locale dir). Trying to symlink them makes me have to include it as an installed file, despite the %file_lang fix. So... I just left it with dupe file complaint for now. Better way to handle?

I also took a swag at the group for this package. Odds are I guessed wrong. That needs a sanity check as well.

(2 comments)

(2 comments)
